top_categories.workout_context: Waucheesi Bike Race rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Waucheesi Bike Race’s appalachian mountains, forest gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Waucheesi Bike Race when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Waucheesi Bike Race. Make this intensity feel like home.
Racing Waucheesi Bike Race isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Waucheesi Bike Race’s appalachian gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Waucheesi Bike Race’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Waucheesi Bike Race — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Waucheesi Bike Race’s appalachian gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Waucheesi Bike Race — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Waucheesi Bike Race’s 5,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Waucheesi Bike Race — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on appalachian gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Waucheesi Bike Race’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Waucheesi Bike Race requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on appalachian gravel to build confidence. Expect: appalachian mountains, forest gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 75 miles of appalachian gravel in Tellico Plains, Tennessee.
